discussion_comments.comment_body: The current version is 0.30 so I think we should use that (and whatever the current version is of the other libraries) unless there is something stopping us. https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-rust/releases https://crates.io/crates/opentelemetry

I have been bitten by this, there's a VS Code extension called `crates` which presents this nicely.
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=serayuzgur.crates

commented_code:
+[package]
+name = "goose-secure-store"
+version.workspace = true
+edition.workspace = true
+authors.workspace = true
+license.workspace = true
+repository.workspace = true
+description = "Secure storage for MCP server secrets"
+
+[dependencies]
+keyring = { version = "3.6", features = ["apple-native", "windows-native", "sync-secret-service"] }
+thiserror = "2.0"
+serde = { version = "1.0", features = ["derive"] }
+serde_json = "1.0"
+serde_yaml = "0.9"
+console = "0.15"
+jsonschema = "0.18"
+etcetera = "0.8"

discussion_comments.comment_body:
Please review these libraries and their versions. Many are old versions. Eg.
- jsonschema is up 0.30
- serge_yaml crate is [deprecated/no longer maintained](https://github.com/dtolnay/serde-yaml/releases) for more than a year. Although I see it is already in use in other crates :/
